title: Painted Coffin Interior
description: Base of a coffin, with large figure of a god wearing a nemes (Amenhotep I?) facing right; before him, several registers of figures or text
section: Preparing for and Sending to the Afterlife

museum_location.name: Funerary Gallery 1, Martha A. and Robert S. Rubin Gallery, 3rd Floor

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 37.1810E
labels.content: In the interior painting on this bottom half of a coffin, the large figure represents Osiris, king of the dead. The mummy would have originally lain on top of this figure, thereby associating the deceased with the king who was successfully reborn into the afterlife. Lesser figures here include three images, in the top and second registers, of the human-headed bird called the ba-soul, which acts on behalf of the deceased in our world; and deities such as Anubis and Horus, who here protect Osiris by supporting his legs.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
